about.title: Overview.
about.presentation:
As a full-stack engineer with a robust foundation in computer science, I specialize in architecting and delivering comprehensive software solutions.

My expertise encompasses developing responsive user interfaces, designing robust back-end services, managing databases, and deploying applications in cloud environments.

I thrive on solving complex technical challenges and collaborating to translate abstract concepts into tangible, high-performing digital experiences, consistently embracing continuous learning and technological evolution.

form.placeholderMessage: What do you want to say?
form.successMessage: Thank you for contacting me! I will get back to you soon.

experience.titleDescription: What I have done so far
experience.title: Work Experience.

points: Performed AEM authoring activities, including content entry, formatting, and publishing through predefined templates and reusable components.
Managed and organized digital assets within AEM DAM, ensuring proper usage, metadata tagging, and consistency across multiple campaigns.
Collaborated with designers and developers to maintain brand consistency, usability, and responsive design standards.
Verified content accuracy and display across browsers and devices, resolving issues related to formatting and layout.
Supported internal stakeholders by documenting authoring best practices and assisting in troubleshooting content-related issues.
Executed authoring tasks in Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), creating and updating web pages while ensuring alignment with client brand and technical requirements.
Customized and configured AEM components using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, adapting content to meet business and design specifications.
Partnered with Creative, Business, Technology, and QA teams to deliver content solutions on time and with high quality standards.
Conducted content validation, functional testing, and accessibility checks to guarantee compliance before release.
Provided feedback on AEM templates and workflows, contributing to continuous improvement of content authoring processes.
Develop and maintain web applications following SCRUM methodology.
Implement front-end solutions using JavaScript, Angular, and React, applying Feature-Sliced Design (FSD) architecture.
Build and integrate microfrontend architectures using single-spa.
Integrate authentication systems with Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD) and Clerk.
Develop back-end services with C#, .NET, and Docker.
Configure and maintain CI/CD pipelines in Microsoft Azure, automating build, test, and deployment processes.
Collaborate with QA to deliver high-quality, bug-free code, ensuring requirements compliance.
Design and update MySQL databases, ensuring data integrity and efficient query performance.
Analyze Pull Requests (PRs) to ensure code quality and compliance with best practices as a Developer Lead.

elias.testimonial: Carlos is very quick learner, and excels at taking care of his area of expertise in Content Authoring and FE development (you name it and he knows it).
elias.imageTitle: Andrés Elías Vargas - AEM Architect at Kaiser Permanente

andrea.testimonial: His ability to balance multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively has been instrumental in the successful execution of the digital initiatives at our company.
andrea.imageTitle: Andrea Benavides - Senior Digital Project Manager at Critical Mass Latam

brenes.testimonial: Carlos is exceptional. He is always willing to help with any technical questions, whether they relate to backend or frontend development.
brenes.imageTitle: Luis Brenes - Full Stack Developer at Factor K Software

adrian.testimonial: Carlos's proactive approach and ability to think critically make him an asset to any technology-focused role.
adrian.imageTitle: Adrian Carmiol - AEM Content Author Lead at Critical Mass Latam

floriana.testimonial: Carlos exhibits a strong sense of ownership, consistently delivering his work with precision and completeness.
floriana.imageTitle: Floriana Fonseca - Project Manager at Critical Mass Latam

paolo.testimonial: Carlos is a quick learner and has a great attitude. He is always willing to help with any technical questions, whether they relate to backend or frontend development.
paolo.imageTitle: Paolo Vargas - Senior Content Author Lead at Critical Mass Latam

works.title: Projects.
works.description:
The projects I have worked on are listed below. Feel free to check them out and give me your feedback.
Each project is briefly described with links to code repositories. It reflects my ability to solve problems, work with different technologies, and manage projects effectively.

uiLibrary.name: UI Component Library
uiLibrary.description: UI Component Library is a collection of reusable UI components that can be used to build web applications. It is built with React and CSS, using storybook for documentation and testing.

expropriation.name: Expropriation Management System
expropriation.description: Expropriation Management System is a web application that enables users to manage the expropriation process. It is built with c# and .NET, using using blazor for the frontend and sql server for the database.

paceFE.name: Performance Evaluation System Frontend
paceFE.description: Performance Evaluation System Frontend is a web application that enables a company to manage the performance evaluation process. It is built with React and tailwind css.

paceBE.name: Performance Evaluation System Backend
paceBE.description: Performance Evaluation System Backend is a web application that enables a company to manage the performance evaluation process. It is built with c# and .NET, using mysql for the database.

helicopter.name: Helicopter game
helicopter.description: Helicopter is a game about a vessel that tries not to crash into obstacles. It enables a user to control a helicopter and avoid obstacles. It is built with python and pygame.

airplane.name: Airplane passengers
airplane.description: Airplane passengers is a project that simulates the registration of passengers of an airline. It is built with java and swing.
